description.narrative: Output objective is to enable policy framework and capacity development for green energy SMEs and access to finance and business models for green energy SMEs and energy service users piloted

Regional component will support work at national level in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan and below indicators are developed to access results that will be achieved at the national level. 1. Number of policy recommendations for private investments in providing green energy through SMEs developed and presented with national stakeholders in both countries (3) 2. Number of people (disaggregated by sex and age) trained on construction, maintenance and installation of their own energy efficient cook stoves, solar thermal systems and other energy generating systems (500) 3. Number of women and men led SMEs established with support by Energy Access Centers (5) 4.1 Number of microcredit institutions and banks joining the Energy Access Fund (8) 4.2 Number of tailor made crowdfunding products designed with crowdfunding platforms (4) 4.3 Number of financial incentives ensuring women’s access to finance (3) 5. Number of business models piloted with established SMEs (4) 6.1 Number of minigrids implemented on a village level in Tajikistan (8) 6.2 Number of public buildings in villages with operational and sustainable PV and heating energy systems (20) 6.3 Number of households supported with green energy access through operational and sustainable small-scale technologies with ensured project co-financing (5000)

comment.narrative: 1. No enabling policy framework for energy access for SMEs 2. Lack of knowledge and awareness on energy access and energy efficient equipment, products and services 3. Scarce information for SMEs and their customers on affordable finance and how to access it 4. No knowledge on innovative financing mechanisms 5. No knowledge on innovative business models for SMEs 6. Access to sustainable energy services in remote rural areas not easily obtained

Regional component will support work at national level in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan and below targets present cumulative results that will be achieved at the national level in 2 countries. 1. 1 2. 200 3. 2 4.1 1 4.2 2 4.3 2 5. 1 6.1 3 6.2 8 6.3 2000

Regional component supported COs in the following areas: (i) development and implementation of enabling policies and regulations for energy access; (ii) establishing the energy access funding platform; (iii) identifying rural public buildings for provision of green energy solutions; and (iv) conducting feasibility surveys to locate and install mini-grids. The cumulative results on targets are the following: 1. Support provided in completion of 12 policy recommendations in providing green energy 2. Support provided in trainings delivered, covering 1044 people on construction, maintenance and installation of their own energy efficient cook stoves, solar thermal systems and other energy generating systems. 3. Support provided in supporting 5 SMEs through energy access centers. 4.1 Support provided in establishing 10 partnerships with MFIs. 4.2 Support provided in launching 3 crowd-funding platforms. 4.3 Providing support to 2 finance incentives, ensuring women’s access to finance. 5. Support provided in testing 4 business models in the programme countries. 6.1 Support provided in implementing 7 off-grid solutions in Tajikistan. 6.2 Support provided in selecting 31 public buildings, operationalized with sustainable PV and heating systems. 6.3 Support provided in green energy access coverage in the programme countries, covering 16,095 households.

Regional component will support work at national level in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan and below targets present cumulative results that will be achieved at the national level in 2 countries. 1. 1 2. 150 3. 2 4.1 3 4.2 1 4.3 0 5. 1 6.1 3 6.2 8 6.3 2200

Regional component supported COs in the following areas: (i) development and implementation of enabling policies and regulations for energy access; (ii) establishing the energy access funding platform; (iii) identifying rural public buildings for provision of green energy solutions; and (iv) conducting feasibility surveys to locate and install mini-grids. The progress on targets are the following: 1. Support provided in completion of 3 legislations in the programme countries. 2. Support provided in trainings delivered, covering 359 people in the programme countries. 3. Follow up discussions conducted for introducing the energy access funding platform 4.1 Support provided to create a pool of MFIs and bank with consultations organized as part of the energy access funding platform. 4.2 Support provided in identifying two crowdfunding mechanisms. 4.3 the work is in progress. 5. The work is ongoing. 6.1 The work is still ongoing and exact figures to be reported in 2020. 6.2 Support provided in screening of public buildings to implement green technology solutions in the programme countries 6.3 Support provided in undertaking feasibility studies to implement sustainable small-scale technologies in the programme countries.

Regional component will support work at national level in Tajikistan and Kyrgyzstan and below targets present cumulative results that will be achieved at the national level in 2 countries. 1. 0 2. 150 3. 1 4.1 4 4.2 1 4.3 1 5. 2 6.1 2 6.2 4 6.3 800

Significant progress has been registered and targets will be reached during the first half of 2019. The project covered the preparatory assessments to ground policy reccomendations. Overall, the project had an intense inception phase during which it had to overcome some delays and challenges. Activities were focused by and large on setting up the management structures and mobilizing goods and services including proactively sourcing the necessary technical expertise, for comprehensive technical assessments work which will underpin the necessary recommendations and amendments for the advancement of progressive and enabling policies for the deployment of sustainable energy systems in both countries. The progress on 2018 targets is the following: 1. Preparatory assessments to be finalised by end 2018 2. Project event in Kyrgyzstan with the participation of Tajikistan representaitves has been organized. Participatory approaches in both countries have been supported, and several multi-stakeholders roundtable meetings have been organized, through whcih the project has promoted informaiton on EE/RES. 3. Project event in Kyrgyzstan with the participation of Tajikistan representaitves has been organized 4. Preliminary results, feasibility of proposals, needed regulatory changes enabling companies and energy service providers (RESCO) to offer services on the market and also the first proposal of the Green Energy Access Platform were discussed and agreed with the stakeholders 5.Target not reached, work is still unfolding at the time of reporting. 6. Activties were initiated however, targets will be achieved in 2019, when project results will be more mature.
